statements.name: PROC GREDUCE
statements.description: Identifies the input and output map data sets. Can specify the reduction criteria.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: identifies the map data set that you want to process.

arguments.name: E1=
arguments.description: specify the minimum distance that a point must lie from a straight line segment to be included at density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, respectively.

arguments.name: E2=
arguments.description: specify the minimum distance that a point must lie from a straight line segment to be included at density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, respectively.

arguments.name: E3=
arguments.description: specify the minimum distance that a point must lie from a straight line segment to be included at density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, respectively.

arguments.name: E4=
arguments.description: specify the minimum distance that a point must lie from a straight line segment to be included at density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, respectively.

arguments.name: E5=
arguments.description: specify the minimum distance that a point must lie from a straight line segment to be included at density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, respectively.

arguments.name: LATLON
arguments.description: specifies that the LAT and LONG variables from the map data set are used for coordinate data instead of the Y and X variables.

arguments.name: N1=
arguments.description: specifies that for density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, the boundary of a unit area should contain no more than max-points points.

arguments.name: N2=
arguments.description: specifies that for density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, the boundary of a unit area should contain no more than max-points points.

arguments.name: N3=
arguments.description: specifies that for density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, the boundary of a unit area should contain no more than max-points points.

arguments.name: N4=
arguments.description: specifies that for density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, the boundary of a unit area should contain no more than max-points points.

arguments.name: N5=
arguments.description: specifies that for density level 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, the boundary of a unit area should contain no more than max-points points.

arguments.name: NOCLEAN
arguments.description: disables post-processing cleanup of the output data set.

arguments.name: NORETRY
arguments.description: prevents additional reduction of polygons in the output map data set.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the new map data set, which contains all of the observations and variables in the original map data set plus the new DENSITY variable.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: Identifies the variable or variables that define the hierarchy of the current unit areas in the input map data set.

arguments.name: id-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables in the input map data set that identify unit areas. Id-variable(s) can be either numeric or character.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Lists the variable or variables that identify the new unit areas.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables in the input map data set that define the new unit areas. Variable(s) can be either numeric or character.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: indicates that the input map data set is sorted in descending order.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations with the same BY-variable values are to be grouped as they are encountered without regard for whether the values are in alphabetical or numerical order.
